text:
Hi guys,
I am trying to create a form, in which I want to implement a drop-down field that will be populated from a HubDB table. The form is created as a HubSpot form in the Marketing-->Lead Capture-->Forms module.
The challenge that I faced is that values from HubDB table can not be bound within a HubSpot form. Eventually I came up to this page: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form> , where it is elaborated how to process the form if it is a custom built form. Now I am struggling in how to embed this back-end code inside HubSpot... or with other words where should I put this process script, knowing that I am able to write only Hubl code inside pages.
Also I will be glad if someone can suggest some Hubl form building tool, plugin or something...
Any help will be appreciated...
Thanks

hi Viktor, if you want to use the API you need to render the form youself.
The API are not meant to be used together with HubSpot's form embed code.
PS: there's a new API that is easier to integrate with <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3>

Hey Marco,
so the JSON needs to be sent to the endpoint?
Will HubSpot import postmeta from Wordpress?
Does it import any of those fields?
Yes, all field are importing but only not importing blog copyright
I’d be surprised as postmeta looks to be unstructured data.
So other postmeta is being imported?
can you send me a bigger excerpt of the xml in private chat?
please don’t mind but let me ask our team for this

nesting custom modules is not supported. largely because it would create a bad experience for both the editor and the developer as well as possibly cause recursion.

Most situation’s that you would nest modules  `dnd_area` solves for in a better way.

<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/drag-and-drop-areas>

Hi,
I am building an email template (HTML & Hubl). The template displays an image. When I test template, the image is displaying on all other email clients.

But with outlook (on windows), it adds a huge gap(large whitespace) instead of displaying image. I tried to add image field so that I can simply use snipped instead of <img> tag, but the problem still persists.  How can I solve this?

Outlook is really terrible to optimize for images - if Image blocking is on they will not see the image, if it's a background image you will need to add special tags for it to load. I'd recommend checking out some resources on google to resolve this. Here is a good link to get you started: <https://www.emailonacid.com/blog/article/email-development/html-background-images-in-email/>
